item.title: Amazon & Their Taxes
item.description: Reuters is reporting on the history and legal problems of Amazon’s taxes. Apparently, last year the IRS demanded $1.5 billion in back-taxes from “transfer pricing [of their] our foreign subsidiaries,” amounting to just under a tenth of their gross annual profit. The article doesn’t take much knowledge of tax law to understand, but for the tl:dr crowd, here is the gist: In 1999, Amazon began to bring foreign profits home from their French and British operations to balance the losses in the US, which at the time amounted to over $1 billion.
